newsitem.title: USA: Managers split over tech stock outlook - Barron's.
newsitem.headline: Managers split over tech stock outlook - Barron's.

text.p: Applied Materials Inc and Level One Communications Inc are among the technology stocks favored by some following the tech industry, Barron's reported Sunday.
Barron's said fund managers, research heads and others at a conference of the American Electronics Association are divided over the outlook for technology stocks.
Michael Murphy, editor of the California Technology Stock Letter, believes equipment stocks are cheap enough to buy and recommends Applied Materials, Barron's said.
Barron's said Murphy's buys of more specialized equipment stocks include Mattson Technology Inc, Plasma & Materials Technologies Inc, OnTrak Systems Inc and Genus Inc.

Barron's said Needham & Co President Raj Rajaratnam is keen on personal computer and peripherals stocks, but is cautious about semiconductor stocks, while Bret Rekas of Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette is cautious about PC makers and doesn't have a buy recommendation for any.
Rajaratnam favors Intel Corp, Compaq Computer Corp, Dell Computer Corp, Seagate Technology Inc, Western Digital Corp and Read-Rite Corp, Barron's said.

Barron's said Roger McNamee, a partner in Integral Capital Partners in Menlo Park, California, likes prospects for Level One Communications Inc, Sierra Semiconductor Corp and Netscape Communications Corp.

Jerome Fischer, director of equity research at Fox Asset Management, believes it is safe to start buying semiconductor equipment stocks such as KLA Instruments Corp and Applied Materials, Barron's said.
